main event: Unidentified aircraft and bright lights were observed near Cho-do, North Korea on multiple occasions in 1953 and 1963.
interesting points: Five bright lights were sighted in a line formation, maintaining constant brightness and altitude around 1000 ft., The sighting lasted for several minutes without any sound or maneuvers from the objects, A Marine Sergeant reported seeing a bright light resembling a comet with colorful tails, The events were documented by military personnel and have been associated with balloon movements in the area, The sightings were reported by multiple witnesses including a Sergeant and other Marines.
witness description: military personnel, including a United States Marine Sergeant
